DOC.brief_summary: The study evaluate vital sign change 3 different dental procedure perform patient dentist . The patient select randomly healthy adult . The aim look significant change major vital sign ( heart rate , respiratory rate , blood pressure , peripheral capillary oxygen saturation ( SpO2 ) body temperature ) specify dental procedure ( scale , simple restoration , simple exodontia ) compare change 3 procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Vital Signs Changes During Dental Procedures
DOC.criteria: The patient include one plan follow 3 dental treatment 3 separate visit do dentist : supragingival scale without local anesthesia ( LA ) , simple dental extraction LA , simple restoration LA . Patients 18 year old Patients know medical history systemic disease like hypertension , diabetes , bleed disorder Patients history cardiac surgery ; include pace maker insertion Patients medication Smokers , alcoholic , drug abuser Pregnant patient Patients acute infection without fever Patients preoperative pain score 4 visual analogue scale 10 ; 0 = pain 10 = worst pain imaginable Patients 2 simultaneous dental procedure per visit Patients undiagnosed hypertension find hypertensive accord World Health Organization ( WHO ) definition baseline preoperative reading
